creator: mseaborn@categoric.com
text:
The XML pack (see http://java.sun.com/xml/) comes with a catalina-ant.jar which 
provides the Ant Task Deploy (org.apache.catalina.ant.DeployTask) to deploy WAR 
by PUTting the binary in the HTTP call and use the 'deploy' method.  

This however is not supported by Catalina and it does not appear that it will 
be.  This method would be extremely useful.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
The web services pack is based on the development branch of Tomcat, so it 
includes features which will only be available in the next major release of 
Tomcat.

creator: mseaborn@categoric.com
text:
Please claify that you can used the DeployTask, which makes the call 
http://HOSTNAME:8080/manager/deploy?...

I am surprised as this method is simply not supported in the source-code of 
ManagerServlet which handles these things.

This will only be available in the next major release of Tomcat. 4.0.x does not 
support it.
